title: Go Tell It on the Mountain - style of the passage

content.question: The style of the passage as a whole is characterized by

choices.label: simple declarative sentences containing a minimum of descriptive language
sentences that contain several modifying phrases and subordinate clauses
sentences that grow progressively more argumentative as the passage continues
expository sentences at the beginning that give way to interpretive sentences at the end

content.answer: sentences that contain several modifying phrases and subordinate clauses

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
